page.title: 07Housing in S. Cambridge (1)
page.content: Romsey,Newtown and Newnham areas were all developed in the 19th and 20th centuries with the tremendous growth in the town and university population (5 fold between 1801 and 1901). Romsey developed as an area of small houses,schools,churches and shops in the eastern part of the city on the old east field. The railway brought many jobs. Newtown developed on the meadow land on the south side - Coronation Street at the time of the coronation of George IV in 1830. This area had some large prosperous Victorian houses,with smaller dwellings (for servants originally) and many shops.In the 19th century and today,there are Catholic,Anglican and private schools,many pubs and small shops and 2 churches dominating the sky line.
